strIntroduction: The Sumida River Line runs from Asakusa to Hama Rikyu Onshi Teien (Hama Rikyu Gardens). In Asakusa, head to the river to board your boat for a relaxing 40-minute Sumida River cruise (with an English audio guide). You'll glide through Tokyo and go underneath 12 bridges, providing a different perspective on the city. Listen to recorded commentary about the sights you pass as you cruise along this historically significant waterway. The dock at Hama Rikyu is located within the garden's grounds. Hama Rikyu is a large, attractive landscape garden in central Tokyo. Located alongside Tokyo Bay, Hama Rikyu features seawater ponds which change levels with the tides. There is also a teahouse on an island where visitors can rest and enjoy the scenery. The traditional garden stands in stark contrast to the skyscrapers of the adjacent Shiodome district (※Please install "Tokyo Parks Navi"application corresponded to English). From Hama Rikyu, walk to Tsukiji Outer Market. The Tsukiji Outer Market, known as the Jogai Shijo, is Japan's "Food Town," where one can encounter all of Japan's traditional foods. A mixture of wholesale and retail shops along with numerous restaurants line the streets. This is where new culinary trends are born. Take a walk around and experience the taste of Japan first hand. We offer a special plan for you, which includes all the above. The following is the schedule: 10:20: Meeting up/Reception at Asakusa Pier of Tokyo Cruise 10:40: Sumida River Cruise from Asakusa to Hama Rikyu - Walk in Hama Rikyu - Walk from Hama Rikyu to Tsukiji Outer Market (15 – 20 minutes) - Free time in Tsukiji Outer Market 13:30: All-you-can-eat sushi 14:30: End of the tour * The course and time are subject to change. * You will walk for approximately 3 km. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes to walk in. * Participants must be 3 years or older. * Includes the cruise ticket, admission fee, guide, cruise map, Tsukiji map, and lunch. Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy River Cruise, Garden and Sushi in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Fruit picking is one of the most popular activities in Japan for couples and families! A great place to enjoy this unique cultural experience is Nakagomi Orchard. Located in Yamanashi Prefecture, visitors can see the breathtaking beauty of Mt. Fuji in the middle of Mother Nature. There are a variety of fruit picking packages to choose from, so you can find your favorite combination. The availability depends on the season. A list of available fruit through the year is below: - Cherries - Peaches - Sweet nectarines - Plums - Nashi (Japanese pears) - Grapes - Prunes - Persimmons - Apples Directions to Nakagomi Orchard: - Head to JR Kofu Station in Yamanashi - Go to Platform Number 5 at JR Kofu Station's Bus Terminal - Get on a bus headed towards Nishino Keiyu (via Noshino) (30 minutes) - Get off at Sangai Bus Station - From the bus terminal, you will see a crossroads on the west side. - Go up the road about 500 meters and you will see a sign for the farm on your left. Note - Please contact the farm once you get off the bus at Sangai.
strTitle: Enjoy Fruit Picking at Nakagomi Orchard in Yamanashi!

strIntroduction: Experience some of the best entertainment and cultural options Fukuoka has to offer with this one day tour. Star off your day with a visit to the stunning cultural assets of Raizan Sennyoji Daihioin Temple with over 1,300 years of history, where you will be amazed by the 1,000-Armed Standing Kannon and the Seated Seiga Shonin statues. Next, head to the Ichiran's Mori ramen factory and museum where you will learn about the production process of this popular dish. You will be able to try Fukuoka's specialty: pork bone ramen. As we head Marinoa city, you will be able to appreciate from the bus the stunning views of Kofuji volcano and the beautiful Terayama Coast. The tour will then take you to Marinoa City Outlet Fukuoka, where you will have the chance to indulge in world-class shopping, with more than 170 stores featuring major brand names. The tour also inlcudes a free ticket to ride the Skywheel Ferries Wheel located at Marinoa city as well as a free coupon to be used in the shops at Marinoa city mall. Take advantage of this opportunity to explore different kinds of attractions that Fukuoka has to offer and book your tour!
strTitle: Visit Ichiran Ramen Factory & Marinoa City Mall in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Taste the delicious flavors of Fukuoka with this one day tour departing from Hakata. In the morning, the tour will visit a fruit farm, where depending on the time of the year of your visit, you will be able to pick and savor fresh, delicious fruit: January to mid-May (strawberries) July to August (blueberries, peaches, Kyoho grapes, grapes, or pears) September (Kyoho grapes, grapes or pears) Early- to mid-October (pears) Late October to early December (persimmons). Next, you will visit Kyoho winery, home of the popular local wine made with Tanoshimaru grapes, and where you will also have the chance to try wine made out of other fruit such as strawberry or blueberry. For people under 20 years, grape juice or amazake (sweet, non-alcoholic rice based beverage) will be provided. You will then visit either Ukiha Roadside Station or Kurume Roadside Station where you will be able to pick-up fresh farm products as well as side dishes for you to take home. Lastly, you will visit Kirin beer farm, where you will indulge in an all-you-can-eat BBQ lunch including succulent dishes with beef, pork and chicken. Don't miss the chance to treat yourself to the delicacies of Fukuoka prefecture, and enjoy a delicious and fun day!
strTitle: Enjoy a Fruit Picking & All-You-Can-Eat BBQ Tour in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Have you ever heard of the Shamisen before? This guitar like instrument is played in accompaniment with a geisha's dancing, along with many other traditional settings. Why not take up this unique opportunity and learn to play this instrument? The beautiful and subtle tone represents the Japanese aesthetic and you will be able to experience it first hand. Lessons are taught by expert teachers in English and they will provide textbooks in English too! To top it off, you can experience playing some Ozashiki games, normally played in very formal settings with Geishas. These simple yet historical games are unique and most of all, so much fun! You won't get to experience this outside of Japan, so hurry and book this before it sells out! Option detail: Duration- 1 hour Must be over 10 years old
strTitle: Experience playing the Shamisen and play Ozashiki Games!

strIntroduction: If you are interested in Japanese cultural arts and crafts , here's a good one to try. This class is about "Sumie" which is the Japanese word for Black Ink Paintings. You don't need to be artistic because there are no mistakes in this art. Each stroke adds your own character to the paintings. Sumie/Suibokuga are paintings done in black ink (sumi), in which nuances are expressed through variations in brush techniques and through contrasted shadings of ink. This was established as a genre in Japan after Song- and Yuan-dynasty paittings of this type brought back from China by practitioners of Zen in the 13th and 14th centuries. Usually you can see them on fusuma sliding door panels in Buddhist temples. Don't be nervous, just try it! A teacher will teach you the basics of the art with various different traditional sumie subjects, and will even take requests for pictures you want to try. You will be amazed at how professional your art will look. Schedule: 13:00, 15:00, 17:00 Option Detail Sumie Master class: This is a class by a master Toyokuni. Tue.- Sat. 12:00 - 17:00 Sun. Holiday 12:00 - 15:00
strTitle: Enjoy Fun Sumie Ink Painting Lessons in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Mt. Fuji is Japan's highest mountain and a nearly perfectly conically shaped volcano that has been worshiped as a sacred mountain for hundreds of years. It has also been popular among artists throughout the centuries. Lake Ashinoko was formed in the caldera of Mt. Hakone after the volcano's last eruption 3,000 years ago. Today, the lake with Mt. Fuji in the background is the symbol of Hakone and a wonderful sight. On this tour a helicopter will fly you up into the sky of Hakone Ashinoko, where Mt. Fuji is said to be viewed at its most beautiful. From the helicopter you will be able to enjoy the best views of Lake Ashinoko in combination with Mt. Fuji. Furthermore, you can look down on the beautiful spots from Tokyo to Mt. Fuji along the route. Surely there is no better way to enjoy the area and majestic Mt. Fuji than with this flight-tour. The following conditions will apply: * The cruising may be cancelled due to bad weather. In this case, you will receive the refund. * It is not guaranteed that Mt. Fuji is definitely seen. * The passenger must be 3 years or older. * According to the instructions of Civil Aviation Bureau, you must write down your body weight before boarding. Summary of the cruising: Available number of passengers: 2 – 5 Flight schedule: 9:30: Meeting up at Heliport 10:00: Departure 11:00 – 11:20: Coming back to Heliport Flight time: Airframe for 5 passengers: 60 minutes Airframe for 3 passengers: 80 minutes * Note that the airframe you board will be determined on the flight day. Check the Tour Conditions link below. voyag.in/2c7AgMg
strTitle: Enjoy the View of Mt. Fuji and Ashinoko from a Helicopter!

strIntroduction: Hiroshima is a truly special city that captures the heart and soul of Japan and is one of the top choices for visitors. With this activity you can explore it through a unique, fun, and alternative way? This cycling tour will surely leave a lasting memory and you can burn all the calories you've gained while you've been on holiday while enjoying the beautiful, panoramic views of the countryside. Could you ask for more? With experienced, local guides with an excellent knowledge of the area you'll be guaranteed a fun and memorable experience. Please note that tours will be automatically cancelled if there are less than two people, so book now to avoid disappointment! You can choose from the four different plans, listed below: Tour 1: Mt. Shirataki Hiking & Cycling from Innoshima, Mukaishima to Onomichi (17km) Open daily (Closed from Dec. 25 to Jan. 4 and in February) Duration: 5 hours 30 minutes Itinerary: 10:00 Meet at Onomichi JR train station. Pick up a bike. 10:30 Depart Onomichi Port by ferry. 10:49 Arrive at Innoshima Island. 10 min ride to Mt. Shirataki entrance. 11:00 Hiking and Lunch* at Mt. Shirataki. 13:00 Shimanami Kaido Cycling (17 km) calling at Shimanami beach, Ohamasaki Lighthouse and Innoshima Bridge. 15:30 Arrive at Onomichi. Return bike. End of the tour. Tour 2: Cycling from Ikuchijima to Omishima & Visit Oyamazumi Shinto Shrine by bus (round trip)(20km) Open daily (Closed from Dec. 25 to Jan. 4 and in February) Duration: 6 hours 20 minutes Itinerary: 9:10 Meet at Mihara JR train station. 10 minute walk to Mihara Port. 9:45 Depart Mihara Port by ferry. 10:13 Arrive at Setoda Port. 10 minute walk to Setoda Kankokyokai to pick up a bike. 10:50 Shimanami Kaido Cycling (10 km). Tatara Park. Lunch and visit to Oyamazumi Shrine by bus. Return to Tatara Park. 14:30 Shimanami Kaido Cycling (10 km). 15:30 Arrive at Setoda and return a bike. End of the tour.
strTitle: Enjoy Cycling and Hiking in Hiroshima and Shimanami Kaido

strIntroduction: Kawamura, owner of ANell in Ikebukuro, Tokyo has over 10 years of experience in the field of hair styling. His goal is to make sure customers get what they want through the utilization of his knowledge and skills. He also creates a comfortable and relaxing environment that makes guests want to come back again and again. Kawamura and his team of stylists always do their best to make sure their customers are happy and satisfied. While coloring is not a key feature of Japanese hair salons, their coloring and cutting skills are worthy of note, as they do their utmost to keep hair strong, soft and light. If you have time to receive the full salon experience you should give the head spa and treatment a try. Guests receive a head massage where the whole body can relax and the hair is rejuvenated. Come to ANell and enjoy a relaxing treatment while transforming your hairstyle!
strTitle: Enjoy Exciting Japanese Hair Salon Experience in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Souvenir shopping can be a hassle when you have so many places to go with little time. But don't worry, on this page, you can simply select a product of your choice and it will be available to take home with you! The products are all local specialities of certain regions in Japan and they include traditional handcrafts, food, kitchen utensils and various others. Many are traditional products which are hard to access in general souvenir shops. Details are below. ** Product Line-up** --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Tsugaru painted Couple Soup Bowl in Kiri-box (with chopsticks)】ー13800JPY A speciality of the Aomori prefecture - a set of soup bowls in a Kiri(paulownia wood) box with two sets of matching chopsticks. By intentionally disregarding the last "polishing" step in Tsugaru painting, the bowls are presented with an intriguing design and stereoscopic effect. Often purchased as souvenirs or gifts in various occasions. - Size- Large chopsticks : length 23.5cm, handle width 0.8cm Middle-sized chopsticks : length 20.5cm, handle width 0.8cm Soup bowl: diametr 10.6cm, height 7cm Material: Natural Wood --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Tamamushi Lacquerware Wine Glass (Pair) 】ー9100JPY *Grand Prize of the Japanese Gift Competition 2015* A speciality of Sendai, Miyagi prefecture - a set of red and green wine glasses by Tamamushi lacquerware. Tamamushi lacquerware is a special style established in Sendai and is named as "Tamamushi (jewel beetle)" because the colors slightly change depending on the lighting, as do the wings on jewel beetles. The governor of the Miyagi prefecture presented this product to Caroline Kennedy, the US ambassador to Japan when she visited. Often purchased as souvenirs or gifts in various occasions, especially to overseas. Size: Length 5.9㎝ × Width 5.9㎝ × Height 14.8㎝ / each Material: Glass --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Nambu Iron Tetsubin (Cast Iron Kettle) 】ー17700JPY A speciality of Iwate Prefecture. Nambu Iron Tetsubins are made by pouring molten iron into clay or sand molds and was a utensil used in traditional Japanese Tea Ceremonies. By using the Tetsubin to boil water, the flavor significantly changes to become very mellow. This kettle can be used on IH cookers and the form was designed to represent a round moon. The patter is the traditional and unique Arale pattern. Size: Length 18.5cmｘWidth 22.5cm x Height 23cm Weight: 2.69kg Capacity: 1.8L Material: Cast Iron --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Hango Bento box 】ー 13380JPY A speciality of Akita prefecture. This Hango Bento Box is two-layered and made of Akita Japanese cedars, bent into this specific shape. It is a traditional craft designated by the national government. The design is featuring "Hango" a container used to cook rice and is very light and easy to hold. Size: 170 X 90 X 95 mm Capactity：Top Layer 390CC Bottom Layer 500CC (with partation) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Kaji-sho Cold Forged Petit Knife】ー 14100JPY A speciality of Yamagata prefecture. This knife was created by "Kaji-sho" a project team of five smithing companies in Yamagata. The biggest feature of Japanese traditional blades is the Cold Forging technique. The smith cools the forged iron and shapes it again to strengthen the knife. Unique patterns only visible by this process appear and present a distinct originality. The handle is made of Sakura bark and is inner winding to implement a high usability without burden. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 【Kitakata Ramen】ー 3500JPY A speciality of Fukushima prefecture. This product includes 12 packets of Kitakata Ramen, one of the three famous local Ramens in Japan (others are Sapporo and Hakata). The biggest characteristic is its thick and wrinkled noodles, with a smooth soy sauce soup. This would be a perfect gift for anyone who would like to taste the true Japanese Ramen! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * We cannot deliver overseas, the delivery option is only for hotels in Japan. * Please be sure to consume all foodstuffs as soon as possible. * Once submitted, orders may not be cancelled. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Product Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Product Delivery We will deliver your product to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The product will be available upon check-in.
